sections.1_story_intuition: Science and Technology is a crucial topic in competitive exams, covering recent advancements, basic concepts, and their applications in daily life. This section includes key scientific principles, major inventions, Indian achievements, and current developments in technology. Mastery of this topic helps candidates answer both static and current GK questions effectively.
2_key_definitions: Science: Systematic study of the structure and behavior of the physical and natural world.
Technology: Application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes.
Innovation: Introduction of new ideas, methods, or devices.
Research: Systematic investigation to establish facts.
DRDO: Defence Research and Development Organisation.
Artificial Intelligence: Simulation of human intelligence by machines.
Biotechnology: Use of living systems for technological applications.
Nanotechnology: Science of extremely small things.
Renewable Energy: Energy from sources that are naturally replenished.
3_key_facts_data_points: ISRO launched Chandrayaan-3 in 2023.
India's first satellite: Aryabhata (1975).
First Indian in space: Rakesh Sharma (1984).
DRDO develops defense technologies for India.
Green Revolution: Boosted food production in India.
DNA fingerprinting developed in India by Dr. Lalji Singh.
First test-tube baby in India: 1978.
Mangalyaan: India's Mars mission (2013).
5G technology launched in India in 2022.
COVID-19 vaccines developed using biotechnology.
Supercomputer PARAM developed by C-DAC.
India's first nuclear test: Pokhran (1974).
Renewable energy: Solar, wind, hydro.
Artificial Intelligence used in banking and healthcare.
Nanotechnology used in medicine and electronics.
ISRO's PSLV: Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle.
India's first indigenous aircraft carrier: INS Vikrant (2022).
Digital India: Government initiative for technology access.
Biotechnology used in agriculture (GM crops).
India among top countries in space technology.
4_micro_notes: Rakesh Sharma: First Indian in space.
5_exam_capsules: What is ISRO? Indian Space Research Organisation.
Who was the first Indian in space? Rakesh Sharma.
What is Aryabhata? India's first satellite.
What is DRDO? Defence Research and Development Organisation.
What is Mangalyaan? India's Mars mission.
Who developed DNA fingerprinting in India? Dr. Lalji Singh.
What is Pokhran known for? Nuclear test.
What is INS Vikrant? Indigenous aircraft carrier.
What is Digital India? Tech access initiative.
What is renewable energy? Solar, wind, hydro.
What is nanotechnology? Science of small things.
What is biotechnology? Use of living systems.
What is PSLV? Satellite launch vehicle by ISRO.
7_traps_confusing_points: Assuming all satellites are for communication.
Mixing up nuclear and Mars missions.
Assuming all renewable energy is solar.
Mixing up DNA fingerprinting and genetic engineering.
Confusing Digital India with Make in India.

8_case_study_context.title: Mangalyaan: India's Mars Mission
8_case_study_context.explanation: Mangalyaan, launched by ISRO in 2013, made India the first Asian country to reach Mars orbit and the first in the world to do so in its maiden attempt. It showcased India's technological capabilities in space exploration.
